image.altText: A woman with a pink jacket stands and speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Shadow Foreign Affairs Minister Michaelia Cash says Labor must explain "in full" why it imposed targeted sanctions on two Israeli ministers. Follow live.

title.children: Cash says Labor must explain sanctions on Israeli ministers 'in full'

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: Accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson faces more questions from prosecutors as her trial continues. Follow live.

title.children: Prosecutors turn focus to Erin Patterson's mushroom foraging

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A computer issue brings today's hearing to an end
Erin questioned about her children's absence at the lunch
No GP referral sought for gastric-bypass surgery

image.altText: Penny Wong and Anthony Albanese stand at the top of the plane steps with the Australian emblem inside the plane.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has spent years finding his feet on the world stage. In sanctioning two Israeli ministers, his approach to foreign affairs is about to face its biggest test to date.

title.children: Sanctions on Israel will test Albanese's approach to diplomacy

image.altText: A man holds a sign that says 'National Guard LOL' in a street with smoke behind him.

props.synopsis: Depending on your politics, you could see this as either a wannabe dictator illegally trying to quash civil liberties, or local and state-level politicians trying to stymie the policy agenda of a legitimately elected president.

title.children: What on earth is going on in LA? Two competing realities

image.altText: Premier Jeremy Rockliff in press conference

props.synopsis: Six days after losing a no-confidence motion in parliament, Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff is remaining defiant and has again confirmed he will not be resigning as Liberal leader.

title.children: 'I am premier': Rockliff says crossbench was 'deceived' by no-confidence motion

image.altText: A row of men in military wear hold transparent shields that say 'California National Guard'.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says the National Guard will leave Los Angeles "when there's no danger" as ICE intensifies deportation crackdown. Follow live.

title.children: Curfew declared in downtown LA as mayor says city does not need 'armies'

image.altText: A bed in a resident's room in an aged care home.

props.synopsis: The government is under pressure to fund at least 20,000 new at-home care packages for older Australians who need additional support, after the implementation of sweeping sector-wide aged care reforms were postponed.

title.children: 'People are dying on the waitlist': Push for urgent support packages to age at home

image.altText: Moody portrait of a man in a faulty social housing complex.

props.synopsis: A blistering audit finds the government agency tasked with managing Western Australia's water is "not doing anywhere near enough" to protect the resource amid a drying climate.

title.children: Four trillion litres of water extracted yearly in WA without proper oversight

image.altText: Jones on set watching McEvoy talking in microphone to audience.

props.synopsis: Q+A was a rarity in Australian television news history — a show led in part by its audience where anything could happen live on air. Here are some of the most memorable moments.

title.children: Toasters, thrown shoes and stand-offs: Q+A's most fiery moments

image.altText: CCTV screenshot of a man with a beard wearing a beanie and winter jacket inside a store next to shelving

props.synopsis: Police have launched a widespread search of South Australia's northern Flinders Ranges for a man in a rental van who arrived at Arkaroola Village but has not been seen for 11 days.

title.children: Police fear missing man in SA's Flinders Ranges is injured or stranded

image.altText: Plastic bags full of white powder

props.synopsis: The 54-year-old was behind the controls of a so-called black flight carrying $17 million worth of methamphetamine into Queensland.

title.children: Pilot jailed for smuggling 56kg of drugs from PNG to Australia

image.altText: People exit a commercial airliner onto the tarmac at an airport beneath a clear sky.

props.synopsis: Flights between Broome in WA's north and Singapore will cease next month after the sudden announcement by Qantas that Jetstar Asia will cease to operate.

title.children: Broome to Singapore flights canned as Qantas shutters Jetstar Asia

image.altText: A woman speaks in front of her colleagues.

props.synopsis: In a fiery resignation letter, ex-Greens senator Dorinda Cox accuses her former party of racism and ignoring serious claims she raised.

title.children: Dorinda Cox accuses Greens of racism in scathing resignation letter

image.altText: A a look inside terminal at Western Sydney Airport

props.synopsis: Despite Western Sydney International Airport being on track to open in late 2026, clarity on two stumbling blocks remain up in the air.

title.children: First look inside Australia's newest international airport as issues remain

image.altText: Austrian police officers standing at a Graz school

props.synopsis: At least 11 people have died in Austria's deadliest mass shooting in recent history. Here's what we know about how the tragedy unfolded.

title.children: What we know so far about the Austrian school shooting

image.altText: a person holds up a closed fist as someone waves a rainbow pride flag behind them

props.synopsis: While high rates of violence and harassment still affect Australia's LGBTQIA+ Youth, a landmark study has revealed there is a growing focus on joy and support in the community.

title.children: Australia's LGBTQIA+ youth report physical, verbal assault — but also joy

image.altText: A crew wearing orange life vests holds their hands up

props.synopsis: The Freedom Flotilla Coalition which organised the ship, claimed the activists, which included climate protester Greta Thunberg, were detained while sailing through international waters.

title.children: Israel is accused of seizing the Madleen in international waters. Can it do that?

image.altText: Mat Ryan is hugged by Milos Degenek

props.synopsis: The keeper said he felt like he had played his final Socceroos match when he was left out of the starting XI late last year. Now he's celebrated his 100th international with a fine penalty stop as Australia progressed to the FIFA World Cup.

title.children: Socceroos' milestone man wanted to 'freeze time' after Saudi penalty save

image.altText: A silver-bearded man in a blue shirt stands in front of a driveway through pine trees.

props.synopsis: It was meant to be a run-of-the-mill auction with only one interested party, but then locals say nefarious actors turned up and prices soared.

title.children: Peter thought he owned his driveway until it was listed for auction

image.altText: A police vehicle parked at the Alice Springs Hospital

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are investigating a man's death after he fell from a window at Alice Springs Hospital last month.

title.children: Police investigate death in care after man falls from hospital window

image.altText: us president donald trump sits in front of howard lutnick in the oval office

props.synopsis: Australian shares gain moderately after US and Chinese officials announce a "framework" deal to restore the flow of key products between the two countries. Follow live.

title.children: ASX edges up in muted reaction to US-China 'handshake deal'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Qantas shuts down Jetstar Asia, eliminating flights from Broome to Singapore
US and China agree on a framework to resolve their trade disputes
ANZ-Roy Morgan consumer confidence rises a touch

image.altText: A cartoon shows four characters pointing various weapons in a game scenario at something out of frame

props.synopsis: Police are warning Hong Kong residents against downloading the Reversed Front: Bonfire mobile game, saying those who have installed the app may be seen as possessing a publication with seditious intent.

title.children: Hong Kong police say mobile phone game violates security law

image.altText: Men stand in a line in front of Chinese and US flags.

props.synopsis: The US and China have agreed in principle on a framework to carry out an agreement they reached on resolving their trade disputes last month.

title.children: US and China agree on a framework to resolve their trade disputes

image.altText: Two middle aged men with short hair stand side by side as they pose for a photo.

props.synopsis: After being captured by Russia, two prisoners of war were "beaten" and "humiliated" — but not broken. Six months after their release, they are sharing their stories.

title.children: Two men captured in Ukraine reveal what goes on inside Russian prisons

image.altText: A person holds a smartphone. The screen shows an avatar of an AI companion.

props.synopsis: AI-powered friends and partners can fight loneliness, but they can also supercharge isolation. So how can companion apps be made safer?

title.children: Do AI companions fight loneliness, or are they supercharging isolation?

image.altText: The hand of a man in a suit checking the ASX website on his phone at the ASX.

props.synopsis: With the end of the financial year approaching, tax agents say it is a good time to look at maximising your super, which might provide some tax benefits too.

title.children: How to boost your super in a tax-effective way

image.altText: A large poster saying 'Justice for Kumanjayi White' laid on the lawn, with other protest posters and people surrounding.

props.synopsis: More than 100 members of Kumanjayi White's family and community have travelled hundreds of kilometres to gather in Alice Springs for the town's third vigil mourning the young Warlpiri man.

title.children: Warlpiri community travels to Alice Springs to mourn Kumanjayi White

image.altText: A bald man with a white beard and red top sits at a table.

props.synopsis: John planned to live out his days at a caravan park but was issued an eviction notice after nearly two years. He took the case to the Supreme Court which has ruled the eviction attempt "invalid and of no effect".

title.children: Eviction notice for van park resident ruled invalid, as judge blasts 'oppression'

image.altText: a woman is crouching down at a sandstone memorial at a cemetary

props.synopsis: The remains of almost 2,000 people discovered underneath The Hutchins School have been reinterred.

title.children: Bodies exhumed from under Hobart school playing fields laid to rest

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile wading into a river, with the sandy bank in the background.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party is proposing new legislation that would allow crocodile culls and safari style hunting trips in Queensland. That bill is currently before a parliamentary inquiry.

title.children: Conservationist Bob Irwin labels proposed crocodile culling 'a pointless exercise'

image.altText: Person holds microphone and sings into with very focused expression, on smoky stage.

props.synopsis: This powerhouse cabaret about the life and music of Divinyls rockstar Chrissy Amphlett doesn't shoot for imitation; rather it celebrates the trailblazing, rule-breaking musical legend.

title.children: This new show about rockstar Chrissy Amphlett does not hold back

image.altText: A film photograph of a mother in a blue shirt next to her younger daughter.

props.synopsis: Your parents are elderly, your kids need you, and it's up to you to tend to the needs of everyone. Welcome to the sandwich generation.

title.children: Caught in the middle: The women caring for everyone at the same time

image.altText: Woman in lemon-patterned shirt smiling at a table with a red mixer, blue hydrangeas, salad, and a blue scale with pears.

props.synopsis: Now that season two has wrapped, let's look back at your favourite recipes. There's something for everyone, from flavourful tray bakes to a no-mix cake.

title.children: Your favourite recipes from A Bite to Eat with Alice season 2
